      • comparator

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparator()
        Returns a convenience comparator which basically compares objects which implement the Comparable interface. The comparator is null safe in the manner, that nulls are always less than any non-nulls. To have a comparator which places nulls last, use the comparator0() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element types to compare
        Returns:
        the comparator
        See Also:
        comparator0()

      • comparator0

        @Nonnull
public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> Comparator<T> comparator0()
        Returns a convenience comparator which basically compares objects which implement the Comparable interface. The comparator is null safe in the manner, that nulls are always greater than any non-nulls. To have a comparator which places nulls first, use the comparator() method.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the element types to compare
        Returns:
        the comparator

      • asFunc2

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U,V> Func2<T,U,V> asFunc2(@Nonnull
                                   Action0 action,
                                   V value)
        Wraps the given action into a 2 parameter function which returns the supplied value.

        If the callable throws an exception, it gets wrapped into RuntimeException and gets rethrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function first parameter type, irrelevant
        U - the function second parameter type, irrelevant
        V - the return type
        Parameters:
        action - the action to invoke
        value - the value to return
        Returns:
        the new function

      • asFunc2

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U,V> Func2<T,U,V> asFunc2(@Nonnull
                                   Runnable action,
                                   V value)
        Wraps the given Runnable into a 2 parameter function which returns the supplied value.

        If the callable throws an exception, it gets wrapped into RuntimeException and gets rethrown.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the function first parameter type, irrelevant
        U - the function second parameter type, irrelevant
        V - the return type
        Parameters:
        action - the action to invoke
        value - the value to return
        Returns:
        the new function

      • pairUp

        @Nonnull
public static <T,U> Func2<T,U,Pair<T,U>> pairUp()
        Type Parameters:
        T - the first parameter type
        U - the second parameter type
        Returns:
        a function which pairs its arguments

      • negate

        @Nonnull
public static Func1<Boolean,Boolean> negate()
        Returns:
        Returns a function that negates the incoming boolean value.

      • swap

        public static <T,U,V> Func2<T,U,V> swap(Func2<U,T,V> func)
        Returns a function which calls the supplied function with swapped parameter order.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the first parameter, becomes second in func
        U - the second parameter, becomes first in func
        V - the result type
        Parameters:
        func - the function to swap around.
        Returns:
        the swapping function.
        Since:
        0.97
